message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.LG 

Reasoning: 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision): The paper proposes a Visual Grounding Model (VGM) that encodes the panorama into feature maps using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) to predict the Normal Field of View (NFoV) of a 360{\deg} video. 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper also uses an RNN with Gated Recurrent Units (GRU) to encode the subtitles into the same hidden space as the feature maps, and applies soft-attention to trigger sentence decoding. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper deals with narrated 360{\deg} videos, which are a form of multimedia content. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a novel method for automatically grounding the NFoVs of a 360{\deg} video, which involves machine learning techniques such as CNNs, RNNs, and soft-attention. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a machine learning model (VGM) to predict the NFoVs of a 360{\deg} video given the video content and subtitles, and uses a reverse sentence to train the model more robustly.
